Windows File Explorer * MacOS Finder ![](../images/windows_file_explorer.png){.absolute width="45%" top="10%" left="70%"} ![](../images/macos_finder.png){.absolute width="70%" top="60%" left="10%"} --- ## File managers * RStudio ![](../images/rstudio_file_manager.png){.absolute width="70%" top="20%" left="30%"} --- ## Terminals * Interact with file system through prompt/command line * If not familiar with terminal, read primer for [Windows](https://www.computerhope.com/issues/chusedos.htm) or [MacOS](https://developer.apple.com/library/archive/documentation/OpenSource/Conceptual/ShellScripting/CommandLInePrimer/CommandLine.html) ![](../images/terminal.png){.absolute width="80%" top="45%" left="10%"} --- ## Mental model of file directories ![](../images/mentalmodel_workflow.png){fig-align="center"} # Paths ## Paths ### Convert tree structure to character string :::{.fragment} * `exercises/01_introduction/rsconnect/documents/01_introduction.Rmd`
`/shinapps.io/jeffreyrstevens/01_introduction.dcf` ::: ![](../images/directory_dpavir.png){.absolute width="30%" top="50%" left="80%"} --- ## Absolute paths ### From root directory Starts with drive letter or `/` ::: {style="font-size: 95%;"} * Windows:
`C:\users\jeff\Documents\projects\dpavir_2025\R\` * Linux and MacOS:
`/home/jeff/projects/dpavir_2025/R/` ::: --- ## Relative paths ### From current directory * Starts with first subdirectory name * If in `projects/`, relative path to `R/` is `dpavir_2025/R` :::{.fragment} * **Use relative paths!** * Why? ::: --- ## Changing directories ### Change directories with `cd` * `/home/jeff/projects/dpavir_2025/` :::{.incremental} * To move from `dpavir_2025/` to `rsconnect/`, type
`cd exercises/01_introduction/rsconnect/` ::: ![](../images/directory_dpavir.png){.absolute width="30%" top="0%" left="85%"} --- ## Go backwards ### Move backwards with `cd ..` :::{.incremental} * One set of `..` for each directory going backwards * To move from `rsconnect/` to `01_introduction/`,
type `cd ..` * To move from `01_introduction/` to `code/`,
type `cd ../../code/` ::: ![](../images/directory_dpavir.png){.absolute width="30%" top="0%" left="85%"} --- ## Let's try it! :::{.incremental} * Go to _Files_ in RStudio * Add folder named `test` and a subfolder named `R`. * Go to _Terminal_. * Type `ls` or `dir`. * How do we go to `test/`? * How do we go back? * How do we go to `test/R/`? * How do we go back up to `test/`? ::: --- ## Mental model of file directories ![](../images/mentalmodel_workflow.png){fig-align="center"} # Workflows ## Project directory structure :::: {.columns} ::: {.column width="40%"} ![](../images/directory_structure.png){fig-align="center" width="300"} ::: ::: {.column width="60%"} :::{.incremental} * Build a consistent directory structure * Why? * Consistency for you * Adapt structure to your needs or lab requirements * Consistency for the lab * Make a template directory ::: ::: :::: ## Working directories ### Base directory for R session :::{.fragment} * View your working directory * Console: `getwd()` * RStudio: top of Console ![](../images/working_directory.png){.absolute width="60%" top="25%" left="53%"} ::: :::{.fragment} What is your working directory? ::: --- ## RStudio Projects :::{.fragment} ### Convenient system to: * Set working directory * Open files you had open before closing RStudio * Focus on relative paths * Enable version control ### Use them! Always! ::: ![](../images/rproject.webp){.absolute width="20%" top="0%" left="70%"} --- ## RStudio Projects * Let's create an RStudio Project ![](../images/rprojects_new.png){fig-align="center"} --- ## RStudio Projects * Create an RStudio Project in the existing `test/` directory :::{.incremental} * Create your typical project structure * Use the terminal to change directories in your project ::: --- ## Project working directories [`{here}`](https://here.r-lib.org/): The package that sets your working directory to the RStudio Project root directory * `read_csv(here("data/a.csv"))` ![](../images/here_allisonhorst.png){.absolute width="53%" top="25%" left="65%"} :::{.aside} Source: Allison Horst ::: ## Mental model of file directories ![](../images/mentalmodel_workflow.png){fig-align="center"}

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
